Para 9.3 & 9.6 of the referred circular specifies thc jurisdiction of the ROs in this regard. It has been observed that the proposal from the PDs are still coming directly to the Headquarter and are not routed through ROs, therefore a clarilication in respect ol para 9.3 & 9.6 needs to be issued to all PDs and Regional Officers for better compliance at their end. For this purpose, the under mentioned directions are be issued through a general circular to all PDs and ROs: (i) AIl proposal for publication of fee notification in accordance with circular no.16 dated 21,04.2003 and circular no.107 dated 29.09.2009 is to be be prepared by the PDs and be submitted to the Regional Oflicer within the time schedule specified in above circulars_ The RO concerned, will forward with their specific recommendation to concerned technical division in Headquarter with copy to Commercial Operation Division_ (ii) Certain checks are conducted through empanelled agencies at the level of  Headquarter and the  reports submitted by these   agencies were being sent to PD for the comments of the collection agency and o[ the PD for tab suitable action and remedial measures as the case may be. Now the report is to be be sent to the ROs for obtaining action taken report on the observations made by the surveying agency. Therefore the PD will submit the action taken report, after obtaining comment from the collection agency, to RO concerned: RO concern will submit the action taken report to Co Division with his comments and specific recommendations. (iii) As per our circulars no. 70 dated 04.01.2006, 85 dated 06.03.2007 54 dated 09.02.2005, PD's were authorized to engage Toll Supervisor/ Asstt Toll Supervisor and Local Fee Auditors.
